title.narrative: Piaui: Pillars of Growth and Social Inclusion Project

description.narrative: The development objective of the Piaui Pillars of Growth and Social Inclusion Project for Brazil is to: (a) reduce dropout of students in public secondary education; (b) increase access to diagnosis and treatment for patients with chronic diseases; (c) expand the registration of groundwater users in rural areas and land tenure regularization; and (d) increase the participation of rural family farmers in rural productive value chains. The project comprises of two components. The first component, provision of support for the implementation of eligible expenditure programs (EEPs) consists of following five sub-components: (i) improving retention in public secondary education; (ii) expanding access to health care for patients with chronic diseases; (iii) expanding the registration of groundwater users; (iv) strengthening real property rights; and (v) strengthening participation of rural family farmers in rural productive value chains. The second component, provision of technical assistance to strengthen the Borrower's public management consists of following three sub-components: (i) modernize expenditure and investment management in the public sector; (ii) build the Borrower's capacity for water resources management, land management, and rural development; and (iii) generate evidence to support policy-making and practice in education, health, gender, and citizen engagement.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Cooperation Agreements Schedule 2. Section I.C.1 (a) | Description :The Borrower shall, through SEPLAN prior toinitiating any activities under Parts 1.4 and 2.2(b) of the Project, enter into a Cooperation Agreement with INTERPI, for theimplementation of said activities, under terms and conditions satisfactory to the Bank. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Cooperation Agreements Schedule 2. Section I.C.1 (b) | Description :The Borrower shall, through SEPLAN prior toinitiating any activities under Part 2.1(c) of the Project, enter into a Cooperation Agreement with TCE for the implementation ofsaid activities, under terms and conditions satisfactory to the Bank | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements for Part 1 Schedule 2. Section I.B.7 (a) | Description :Prior to the fifth Loanwithdrawal under Category (1) (as referred to in the Project Operational Manual and the Additional Instructions), the Borrowershall carry out a mid-term review with the Bank to evaluate the overall progress in the execution and on the accomplishment of theProject. | Due Date :30-Mar-2018

Finance Agreement :Institutional Arrangements. Schedule 2. Section I.A.1 (a) | Description :No later than two (2) months after theEffective Date, the Borrower shall create and thereafter operate and maintain, until the completion of the Project, a coordinationunit within SEPLAN, to be responsible for the overall coordination of the Project (the “PCU”), all as set forth in the ProjectOperational Manual. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Institutional Arrangements. Schedule 2. Section I.A.1 (b) | Description :No later than one (1) month after theEffective Date, create and thereafter maintain, until the completion of the execution of the Project, at least two Special BiddingCommittees, for purposes of assisting the Participating Entities in carrying out its procurement activities under the Project, withstructure and functions satisfactory to the Bank, as set forth in the Project Operational Manual. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Institutional Arrangements. Schedule 2. Section I.A.1 (c) | Description :No later than eighteen (18) monthsafter the Effective Date, for purposes of carrying out at least two technical audits of the compliance of the DLIs, select andcontract an entity, independent from the Borrower (the Independent Verification Agency) with experience and qualificationsacceptable to the Bank. | Due Date :30-Jun-2017

Finance Agreement :Institutional Arrangements. Schedule 2. Section I.A.1 (d) | Description :No later than two (2) months after theEffective Date, create and thereafter maintain, until the completion of the execution of the Project, a Project ManagementCommittee, with representatives of all the Participating Entities involved in the Project. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Safeguards Schedule 2. Section I.E.1 | Description :The Borrower shall, with the assistance of the pertinentParticipating Entity, implement the Project in accordance with the provisions of the Environmental and Social Management Framework(EMF), the Environmental Management Plan (EMP), the Health Waste Management Plan (HWMP) and Resettlement Policy Framework (RPF),all prepared by the Borrower and approved by the Bank. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: State secretariats with descentralized monitoring and evaluation teams in operation
PIPs benefiting poor rural women or Quilombola communities monitored using PROGERE's new Information Management System [DLI 15]
PIPs implemented and monitored using PROGERE's new Information Management System
Beneficiaries who received registered land titles through the state LTRP
Groundwater users registered in the CERH verified by SEMAR
PIPs proposed by producer organizations led by and mostly comprising of poor rural women or Quilombola communities [DLI 14]
Councils of Sustainable Territorial Development using the SIMO to monitor investments in their jurisdictions
SCCDs operational to receive patients for diagnosis, treatment and follow up [DLI 7]
Patients under diagnosis and/or treatment for chronic diseases in the five new SCCDs
Field visits carried out by SEMAR to verify the registration of groundwater users [DLI 11]
STE schools that have engaged in consultations on content and modalities of training with private sector representatives.
Poor rural women and Quilombola communities participating in PIPs
FHTs and health specialists who have been trained in the use of clinical protocols [DLI 9]
Self-registered groundwater users in the CERH electronic database [DLI 10]
Total number of Project beneficiaries and percent that are female
Teams in place to execute land tenure regularization activities [DLI 12]
Students enrolled in STE (integrated and concomitant) [DLI 4]
State secretariats and agencies using the SIMO
Requests filed by small-scale farmers for land titles through the state LTRP [DLI 13]
Quilombola communities that receive land titles issued by INTERPI
Complaints registered and processed timely by the OGE
Students enrolled in the YSP who pass to the next grade [DLI 1]
Learning assessment tests carried out in public SE and results disseminated at the school level [DLI 6]

target.value: Results disseminated at state and school levels and to parents

target.value: Module on management of framework agreements operational

title.narrative: Information Management System, including the development of software to manage real-time data on the performance and administrationof PROGERE II

actual.value: The final product has already been revised and is under adjustments by the consultant.

title.narrative: Epidemiological survey on the dynamics of neglected diseases, especially Geohelmintiases Leishmaniosis and Chagas Disease

target.value: Action plan based on the survey results developed by SESAPI

title.narrative: Impact evaluation on Tuberculosis and Hanseniasis
Public Expenditure Observatory implemented in CGE-PI
When applicable women are registered as beneficiaries or co-beneficiaries in land titles
Tutoring activities for and monitoring of attendance of SE students enrolled in the YSP [DLI 2]
